places.formattedAddress: PIER 1 1/2 The Embarcadero N, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
places.shortFormattedAddress: PIER 1 1/2 The Embarcadero N, San Francisco

editorialSummary.text: Celeb chef Gastón Acurio serves Peruvian seafood in a large, partially outdoor space on the pier.

text.text: What a great place! Did an early dinner during a layover in San Francisco and we were so happy we stumbled into this restaurant. Food was absolutely excellent, the recommendations from our server were top notch. Service was excellent and the cocktails were just as good. You wont be disappointed eating here!

This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  We have dined there many times and have always experienced a perfect meal and great connective service.
We go here every time we are in SF, and this time, we dined there 3 times.  Yes, that good!
Empanadas are a must.
Octopus is a definite!
Everything else is amazing.  Best Peruvian restaurant I have experienced.

One of my favorite restaurants on San Francisco's Embarcadero. We came here to celebrate a birthday and every dish our party of five ordered was delicious!

Parking can get tricky, but we went right when it opened on a Sunday and found parking close by.

The food here is excellent and has really flavorful options even for those with dietary restrictions. Very refreshing cocktails - definitely can’t skip one here as they are all so delicious! Service can be a bit lacking during weekend peak hours… make sure you get your entire order in at once as it’s hard to get their attention. The space is huge with lot of seating, and the outdoor seating has beautiful views of the bay so definitely make reservations in advance if you’d like the best tables!

This meal was absurd. One of the best meals of my life. Ironically, the best thing served was the taro chips - we kept on reordering them. Highly recommend the ceviche taster, gave a good portion to share of each.

overview.text: Expansive, waterfront Peruvian restaurant serving ceviche and other seafood dishes, plus cocktails.

description.text:
Upscale Peruvian eatery set on Pier 1 1/2 in the Embarcadero neighborhood with bay views.
The large venue features a bar and outdoor seating on the waterfront patio. It's popular for lunch and dinner, and reservations are recommended. People say the staff is attentive.
The menu focuses on seafood. Popular dishes include empanadas, ceviche, and lomo saltado. Guests also like the pisco sours and the desserts.
Visitors praise the location, the atmosphere, and the views.
Customers typically spend $50–100.
